results.title: Study Patterns Pt.2 (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Study Patterns”.
Encourages students to think about and improve their methods of study. Skills covered in part two of the series are; examination skills, numeracy skills, relaxation training, and units “if you are a mature student” and “if you are a disabled student”.

results.title: Study Patterns Pt.1 (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Study Patterns”.
Encourages students to think about and improve their methods of study. Skills discussed are basic skills; reading skills; writing skills; listening skills; participation skills; examination skills and practical skills.

results.title: Study Method
results.brief_description: This “How to Study” guide explores in detail problems students have in studying. Study techniques and their application are examined from both the Educational and Psychological aspects. Includes: effective reading, note taking and study organisation, setting targets and handling anxiety and stress (includes demonstration of relaxation techniques).

results.title: Students in Berlin
results.brief_description: Shows the Free University of West Berlin and students from all over the world in part-time jobs in the city and at their studies. The history of the Free University, from its establishment by the students themselves to its present prosperous condition, with many fine buildings, numerous research institutes and large self-governing student body.

results.title: Struggle for China: the story of the Chinese revolution (D)
results.brief_description: Using a wide variety of material drawn from Archives including propaganda material filmed by American, Chinese Communist, Nationalist and Japanese cameramen, this film reconstructs events in China from 1900-1949, one of the bloodiest and most turbulent periods in history. Narrated by James Mason. WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB

results.title: Structure within the image
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, CBS, Coast Community Colleges, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Photographers Barbara Kasten and Garry Winogrand show how every photographer uses a unique structure within their work. Discusses framing, line, shape, tone and pattern and demonstrates ways to structurally improve photographs.

results.title: Structure of the atom
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
These programs explore the history and development of the model of the atom, from the hypothesis of early Greek philosophers to the wave-mechanical model of modern atomic physicists. Experiments by pioneer atomic scientists such as Bohr, Faraday, de Broglie and Rutherford are recreated through animation and their implications are discussed. The six 10 minute episodes are: 1. “The Earliest models” 2. “Smaller than smallest” 3. “The Rutherford Model” 4. “The Bohr Model” 5. “Spectra” 6.”The Wave-mechanic Model.”
